analyzed: shes pa thams cad sgra'i rjes su song ba'i ngo bo nyid du gnas na yang 'ga' yang don gyi ngo bo mngon du byed pa dang 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though all consciousnesses exist as having the nature of being associated with words, since some are related to the manifestation of the nature of the object,

original: rtog pa dang 'brel ba'i mngon sum nyams su myong bas grub la yang ji ltar bsnyon du rung /
analyzed: rtog pa dang 'brel ba'i mngon sum nyams su myong bas grub la yang ji ltar bsnyon du rung /
translated: how can the experience of a direct perception that is related to conceptualization be refuted?

original: de ltar yang rtar rnam par rtog pa'i dus na yang ba lang mthong ba nyams su myong ba de nyid de /
analyzed: de ltar yang rtar rnam par rtog pa'i dus na yang ba lang mthong ba nyams su myong ba de nyid de /
translated: Thus, even at the time of the conceptual thought of a cow, the experience of seeing a cow is direct perception.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa de nyid kyang mngon sum mo //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa de nyid kyang mngon sum mo //
translated: And that very non-conceptual thought is also direct perception.

original: rtar rnam par rtog pa 'di nyid ba lang mthong ba'i bdag nyid do snyam du brtag par mi nus te /
analyzed: rtar rnam par rtog pa 'di nyid ba lang mthong ba'i bdag nyid do snyam du brtag par mi nus te /
translated: One cannot conceive that this conceptual thought of a cow is of the nature of seeing a cow.

original: rang gi ming gis drangs pa'i ba lang ni de'i tshe mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: rang gi ming gis drangs pa'i ba lang ni de'i tshe mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because at that time, the cow that is drawn by its own name is not apprehended.

original: /'di nyid kyis rtar rnam par rtog pa dang dus mnyam par ba lang du rnam par rtog pa bsal ba nyid do //
analyzed: /'di nyid kyis rtar rnam par rtog pa dang dus mnyam par ba lang du rnam par rtog pa bsal ba nyid do //
translated: By this very [statement], the conceptual thought of a cow at the same time as the conceptual thought of a horse is eliminated.

original: rtog pa dang bral ba smos pas ni 'di bum pa'o snyam pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa mngon sum las phyir phyogs pa'i ngo bo'i rtog pa bsal lo //
analyzed: rtog pa dang bral ba smos pas ni 'di bum pa'o snyam pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa mngon sum las phyir phyogs pa'i ngo bo'i rtog pa bsal lo //
translated: By mentioning free from conceptual thought, conceptual thought that turns away from the nature of direct perception, such as this is a pot, is eliminated.

original: ma 'khrul pa smos pas ni dung la ser por snang ba la sogs pa bsal lo //
analyzed: ma 'khrul pa smos pas ni dung la ser por snang ba la sogs pa bsal lo //
translated: By mentioning non-mistaken, appearances such as yellow in a conch are eliminated.

original: de ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: That [non-mistakenness] is of four kinds:

original: dbang po'i shes pa dang / yid kyi ngo bo dang / rang rig pa dang / rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa dang / yid kyi ngo bo dang / rang rig pa dang / rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: The five kinds of sense consciousness, the mental entity, self-awareness, and the consciousness of the yogi.

original: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga rnams la brten pa'i shes pa ni dbang po'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga rnams la brten pa'i shes pa ni dbang po'i shes pa'o //
translated: The consciousness that is based on the five sense faculties such as the eyes is the sense consciousness.

original: rang gi yul gyi skad cig gis bskyed par bya ba'i skad cig dang / lhan cig pa dbang po'i shes pa mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis bskyed pa'i yid tsam la brten pa nyid kyi phyir yid kyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: rang gi yul gyi skad cig gis bskyed par bya ba'i skad cig dang / lhan cig pa dbang po'i shes pa mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis bskyed pa'i yid tsam la brten pa nyid kyi phyir yid kyi ngo bo'o //
translated: The mental entity is so called because it is based on the mere mind that is generated by the immediately preceding condition of the sense consciousness that is simultaneous with the object that is generated by the object of its own sense faculty.

original: de 'dra ba'i dbang po'i shes pa ni dmus long la sogs pa la med pas de rnams kyi gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gyi yid kyi ngo bo'i skye ba med pa'i phyir yid kyi ngo bo'i mngon sum khas blangs pa la dmus long la sogs pa med parüîΩthal ba med do //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i dbang po'i shes pa ni dmus long la sogs pa la med pas de rnams kyi gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gyi yid kyi ngo bo'i skye ba med pa'i phyir yid kyi ngo bo'i mngon sum khas blangs pa la dmus long la sogs pa med parüîΩthal ba med do //
translated: Since such a sense consciousness does not exist for the blind, etc., the mental entity that is the object of form, etc., does not arise for them. Therefore, the consequence that the blind, etc., do not exist does not follow from accepting that there is a direct perception that is the mental entity.

original: dbang po'i shes pa'i yul gyi bskyed par bya ba'i skad cig ma 'dzin pa'i phyir gzung ba 'dzin pa nyid du thal ba yang med do //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa'i yul gyi bskyed par bya ba'i skad cig ma 'dzin pa'i phyir gzung ba 'dzin pa nyid du thal ba yang med do //
translated: Nor is there the absurd consequence that it apprehends the object of the sense consciousness, because it does not apprehend the moment that produces the object of the sense consciousness.

original: yid kyi ngo bo'i mngon sum 'di @327b yang mig la sogs pa'i bya ba rdzogs pa na tshad mar 'dod do //
analyzed: yid kyi ngo bo'i mngon sum 'di @327b yang mig la sogs pa'i bya ba rdzogs pa na tshad mar 'dod do //
translated: This direct perception that is of the nature of mental consciousness is asserted to be valid when the activity of the eye and so on is complete.

original: mngon sum gang yin pa de 'di la bya ba byed pa bzhin du yang dbang po las skyes pa ma yin na gzhan dbang po las skyes pa gang yin mig btsums pas gzugs mthong ba med pa'i phyir nyams su myong ba dang 'gal ba nyid do zhes 'di
analyzed: mngon sum gang yin pa de 'di la bya ba byed pa bzhin du yang dbang po las skyes pa ma yin na gzhan dbang po las skyes pa gang yin mig btsums pas gzugs mthong ba med pa'i phyir nyams su myong ba dang 'gal ba nyid do zhes 'di
translated: If that direct perception is not produced from the sense faculty, like the activity of the sense faculty, then what is produced from the sense faculty? It is contradictory to experience the form that is not seen by closing the eyes.

original: brtsad par mi bya ste /
analyzed: brtsad par mi bya ste /
translated: This should not be disputed.

original: mig btsums pa'i skad cig ma dang po tsam gyi ngo bo nyid kyis nges pa gzung dka' ba kho na'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig btsums pa'i skad cig ma dang po tsam gyi ngo bo nyid kyis nges pa gzung dka' ba kho na'i phyir ro //
translated: It is difficult to ascertain the nature of the mere first moment of closing the eyes.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad kyi ngo bo gang gis rang rig par gyur pa de ni rang rig pa'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad kyi ngo bo gang gis rang rig par gyur pa de ni rang rig pa'o //
translated: That which is the nature of all minds and mental factors that is reflexive awareness is reflexive awareness.

original: de rnams kyi ngo bo de 'dra bar gnas so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi ngo bo de 'dra bar gnas so //
translated: The nature of these is to exist in such a way.

original: gang gis 'di rnams la gsal ba gzhan la ma ltos par gsal ba yin te /
analyzed: gang gis 'di rnams la gsal ba gzhan la ma ltos par gsal ba yin te /
translated: They are manifest to someone else without depending on another manifestation.

original: sgron me bzhin no //
analyzed: sgron me bzhin no //
translated: Like a lamp.

original: re zhig 'di rnams kyi gsal ba sems pa dang bcas pa rnams kyis mi 'dzin pa rnams ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig 'di rnams kyi gsal ba sems pa dang bcas pa rnams kyis mi 'dzin pa rnams ni ma yin te /
translated: First, those who have intelligence do not apprehend those that are not manifest.

original: ba lang rji'i chung ma yang rang gi blo grub pa la rjes su dpag pa tshol bar mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba lang rji'i chung ma yang rang gi blo grub pa la rjes su dpag pa tshol bar mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For even the wife of a cowherd does not seek to infer what is established by her own understanding.

original: rigs pa'i 'bras bu shin tu thob pa'i dpyod pa 'di bud med dang dmangs tha mal pa'i yang dpyod pa'i gting dpog par gyur to //
analyzed: rigs pa'i 'bras bu shin tu thob pa'i dpyod pa 'di bud med dang dmangs tha mal pa'i yang dpyod pa'i gting dpog par gyur to //
translated: This reasoning, which is the result of analysis, has become the depth of analysis even for women and ordinary people.

original: 'di rnams ni gzhan gyi gsal bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di rnams ni gzhan gyi gsal bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: These are not to be manifested by another.

original: de yang gzhan dus mnyam pa'i dngos po la ni re zhig gsal bar byed pa phan 'dogs pa med pa'i phyir rigs pa med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang gzhan dus mnyam pa'i dngos po la ni re zhig gsal bar byed pa phan 'dogs pa med pa'i phyir rigs pa med pa ma yin no //
translated: And that is not reasonable, because there is no benefit from a manifestor that is simultaneous with the thing that is manifested.

original: dus tha dad pa'i dngos po yang gsal bar bya ba med pa'i phyir 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dus tha dad pa'i dngos po yang gsal bar bya ba med pa'i phyir 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it tenable that different things at different times are illuminated.

original: de'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba 'di rnams kyi gsal ba ni gsal byed gzhan dang bral ba'i phyir rang nyid kyis gsal bar 'os pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba 'di rnams kyi gsal ba ni gsal byed gzhan dang bral ba'i phyir rang nyid kyis gsal bar 'os pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, since these minds and mental factors are free from another illuminator, it is suitable that they illuminate themselves.

original: gal te de lta ma yin na gsal bar 'os pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: gal te de lta ma yin na gsal bar 'os pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: If that were not so, they would not be suitable to be illuminated.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams la bya ba dang byed pa po'i dngos po rang rig pa ni med do //üîΩ'on kyang bems po'i dngos po dang mtshan nyid mi mthun par skye ba nyid rang rig pa zhes bya bas rang las bya ba 'gal bas rang rig pa rku bar byed nus pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams la bya ba dang byed pa po'i dngos po rang rig pa ni med do // 'on kyang bems po'i dngos po dang mtshan nyid mi mthun par skye ba nyid rang rig pa zhes bya bas rang las bya ba 'gal bas rang rig pa rku bar byed nus pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The state of being an agent and action does not exist in minds and mental factors that are reflexive awareness.

original: gang yang bems po'i ngo bo las //
analyzed: gang yang bems po'i ngo bo las //
translated: However, since the mere arising of a state that is different from the nature of an inanimate thing is called reflexive awareness, it is not possible to steal reflexive awareness, since it is contradictory for an action to be done by itself.üîΩAnd also:üîΩThe opposite of an inanimate nature

original: log pa nye bar skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: log pa nye bar skye bar 'gyur //
translated: arises.

original: gang 'di'i bems min ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: gang 'di'i bems min ngo bo nyid //
translated: This very nature of being noninanimate

original: 'di kho na rang rig pa'o //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di kho na rang rig pa'o //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
translated: is reflexive awareness.

original: ji ltar 'di rang la bya ba 'gal bas rnam par shes pa'i rang gsal ba mi bzod bzhin du sgron me'i rang gsal ba bzod par gyur snyam du ma @328a * //
analyzed: ji ltar 'di rang la bya ba 'gal bas rnam par shes pa'i rang gsal ba mi bzod bzhin du sgron me'i rang gsal ba bzod par gyur snyam du ma @328a * //
translated: How is it that, while self-illumination is not tenable for consciousness because of the contradiction of action with respect to itself, self-illumination is tenable for a lamp?üîΩThey do not understand this.

original: shes so ; / yang na sgron me'i yang rang gsal ba mi bzod la rag ga //
analyzed: shes so ; / yang na sgron me'i yang rang gsal ba mi bzod la rag ga //
translated: Or, rather, let self-illumination not be tenable even for a lamp!

original: de lta na 'di ni 'jig rten pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: de lta na 'di ni 'jig rten pa yang ma yin la /
translated: In that case, this is neither worldly nor logical,

original: rtog pa dang ldan pa yang ma yin pas lha rnams dga' bar byed pa btang snyoms su bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtog pa dang ldan pa yang ma yin pas lha rnams dga' bar byed pa btang snyoms su bya ba'o //
translated: so let it be set aside as something that delights the gods.

original: rnal 'byor ni ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab dag ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ni ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab dag ste /
translated: Yoga is meditative concentration and wisdom.

original: de gang rnams la yod pa de dag ni rnal 'byor pa rnams so //
analyzed: de gang rnams la yod pa de dag ni rnal 'byor pa rnams so //
translated: Those who have it are yogins.

original: de dag gi shes pa gang tshad mas grub pa'i don bsgom pa rab kyi mthar phyin pa las byung ba de rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi shes pa gang tshad mas grub pa'i don bsgom pa rab kyi mthar phyin pa las byung ba de rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: The cognition of those who have perfected the culmination of the meditation on the object established by valid cognition is the cognition of yogins.

original: yang dag pa'i don gyi spyod yul lam de las gzhan pa yang rung bsgom pa rab kyi mthar phyin pa la gnas pa gsal ba'i mchog bzung bar snang ba'i rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don gyi spyod yul lam de las gzhan pa yang rung bsgom pa rab kyi mthar phyin pa la gnas pa gsal ba'i mchog bzung bar snang ba'i rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Whether it is the object of the path of the correct meaning or something else, the consciousness that apprehends the supreme appearance arises for one who abides in the culmination of supreme meditation.

original: de ltar yang 'dod pa la sogs pas myos pas sems kyi 'jug pa dag nye bar g-yengs pa'i 'dod chags can la sogs pa bsgom pa na bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa la gsal bar mdun na gnas pa lta bur de snang bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yang 'dod pa la sogs pas myos pas sems kyi 'jug pa dag nye bar g-yengs pa'i 'dod chags can la sogs pa bsgom pa na bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa la gsal bar mdun na gnas pa lta bur de snang bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Thus, for one who is intoxicated by desire and so on, whose mental engagement is distracted, and who is desirous and so on, when meditating, that object of meditation will appear clearly, as if present in front, when the meditation is complete.

original: de la gang tshad mas grub pa'i don bsgom pa rab kyi mthar phyin pa la skyes pa de lag mthil gyi skyu ru ra bzhin du bsgom par bya ba'i don gsal ba mchog gi rnam pa 'dzin pa'i shes pa de ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis bshes pa'o
analyzed: de la gang tshad mas grub pa'i don bsgom pa rab kyi mthar phyin pa la skyes pa de lag mthil gyi skyu ru ra bzhin du bsgom par bya ba'i don gsal ba mchog gi rnam pa 'dzin pa'i shes pa de ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis bshes pa'o
translated: There, for one who has generated the object of meditation that is established by valid knowledge at the culmination of supreme meditation, that consciousness that apprehends the supreme aspect of the clear object of meditation is like a myrobalan fruit in the palm of the hand. That is what the yogis and yoginis call clarity.

original: // gang gsungs pa /
analyzed: // gang gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis gsal ba ru ;
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis gsal ba ru ;
translated: By the power of meditation, clarity arises.

original: / snang 'gyur 'jig la sogs pa bzhi na //
analyzed: / snang 'gyur 'jig la sogs pa bzhi na //
translated: The four, such as the appearance, are in the case of destruction, etc.

original: slu ba med can shes pa gang //
analyzed: slu ba med can shes pa gang //
translated: That cognition which is not deceptive

original: de ni mngon sum rtog med pa'o //
analyzed: de ni mngon sum rtog med pa'o //
translated: is direct perception, non-conceptual.

original: zhes so // rnam pa bzhi ste smos pas ni dbang po nyid kyis mthong gi de la brten pa'i shes pas ni ma yin no snyam pa dang / yid kyi ngo bo'i mngon sum bshad zin pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i rnam pa gzhan zhig yod do snyam pa dang /
analyzed: zhes so // rnam pa bzhi ste smos pas ni dbang po nyid kyis mthong gi de la brten pa'i shes pas ni ma yin no snyam pa dang / yid kyi ngo bo'i mngon sum bshad zin pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i rnam pa gzhan zhig yod do snyam pa dang /
translated: The mention of the four kinds is to eliminate the misconceptions that one sees by means of the sense faculties themselves, not by the cognitions based on them; that there is another kind of direct perception which is of the nature of the mental faculty, as has been explained;

original: rang rig pa yang mi srid pa nyid do snyam pa dang / rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa yang mi srid pa nyid do snyam pa'i log par rtogs pa'i khyad par rnams bsal ba byas pa yin no //
analyzed: rang rig pa yang mi srid pa nyid do snyam pa dang / rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa yang mi srid pa nyid do snyam pa'i log par rtogs pa'i khyad par rnams bsal ba byas pa yin no //
translated: that autocognition is impossible; and that the cognition of the yogi is impossible.

original: de'i yul ni rang gi mtshan nyid de //
analyzed: de'i yul ni rang gi mtshan nyid de //
translated: Its object is the particular.

original: rang ni bdag nyid kyis te gzhan dang thun mong ma yid pa nges pa don byed par rung ba'i ngo bos mtshon pas na rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rang ni bdag nyid kyis te gzhan dang thun mong ma yid pa nges pa don byed par rung ba'i ngo bos mtshon pas na rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: Particular means that which is characterized by its own nature, not shared with others, by a nature which is suitable to perform a function.

original: 'das ma thag par brjod pa de ni mngon sum gyi yul lo //
analyzed: 'das ma thag par brjod pa de ni mngon sum gyi yul lo //
translated: The object of the immediately past cognition is the object of perception.

original: 'dis ni spyi dang bye brag mngon sum gyi yul nyid du sgro 'dogs pa'i ngag phyir zlog go //
analyzed: 'dis ni spyi dang bye brag mngon sum gyi yul nyid du sgro 'dogs pa'i ngag phyir zlog go //
translated: This verse rejects the statement that universals and particulars are objects of perception.

original: mngon sum gyi shes pa 'di nyid tshad ma'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi shes pa 'di nyid tshad ma'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: This very cognition of perception is the result of valid cognition.

original: @328b mngon sum ni tshad ma nyid kyi phyir rgyu'o //
analyzed: @328b mngon sum ni tshad ma nyid kyi phyir rgyu'o //
translated: Since perception is itself valid cognition, it is the cause.

original: rgyu'i bya ba nyid ni 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: rgyu'i bya ba nyid ni 'bras bu ste /
translated: The activity of the cause is the result.

original: de yang rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid tshad ma las tha dad pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de yang rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid tshad ma las tha dad pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: And that is not different from the valid cognition characterized by understanding.

original: tha dad na gal te tshad ma dang rtogs pa dus mnyam par 'byung pa yin no de'i tshe 'di dag la ba lang gi rva g-yas g-yon bzhin du bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa ji ltar yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: tha dad na gal te tshad ma dang rtogs pa dus mnyam par 'byung pa yin no de'i tshe 'di dag la ba lang gi rva g-yas g-yon bzhin du bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa ji ltar yod par 'gyur /
translated: If it were different, if valid cognition and understanding arose simultaneously, then how could they be producer and produced, like the right and left horns of an ox?

original: dus mi mnyam par 'byung ba yin na yang rtogs par bya ba nyid du mi rigs so //
analyzed: dus mi mnyam par 'byung ba yin na yang rtogs par bya ba nyid du mi rigs so //
translated: If they arose at different times, it would not be reasonable for them to be the object of understanding.

original: dus tha dad pa nyid la bya ba dang byed pa'i dngos po des rgol ba mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus tha dad pa nyid la bya ba dang byed pa'i dngos po des rgol ba mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the opponent does not accept that the entity of the action and the agent are different times.

original: gzhan yang dus tha dad na rtogs pa shes pa gzhan zhig pas de'i tshe de'i yang rtogs pa de shes pa gzhan zhig tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang dus tha dad na rtogs pa shes pa gzhan zhig pas de'i tshe de'i yang rtogs pa de shes pa gzhan zhig tu 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if they are different times, then the cognition of the object of comprehension would be different from the cognition of that, and at that time, the cognition of that object of comprehension would be different from that.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i don rtogs pa la skyes bu'i tshe ma lus pa dogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i don rtogs pa la skyes bu'i tshe ma lus pa dogs par 'gyur te /
translated: The entire life of a person would be devoted to the comprehension of objects such as blue.

original: 'di rtogs par ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di rtogs par ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But that is not the case.

original: de ltar yang thog ma'i shes pa 'byung ba'i dus su re zhig don 'di ma rtogs te /
analyzed: de ltar yang thog ma'i shes pa 'byung ba'i dus su re zhig don 'di ma rtogs te /
translated: Thus, at the time when the initial cognition arises, the object is not yet comprehended.

original: rtogs par byed pa ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs par byed pa ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the agent of comprehension has not yet arisen.

original: shes pa gnyis pa skyes pa na yang rtogs pa med de tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa gnyis pa skyes pa na yang rtogs pa med de tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even when the second cognition arises, there is no comprehension because there is no valid knowledge.

original: de'i yang tshad ma nyid la shes pa gzhan skyes pa yang sngar dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i yang tshad ma nyid la shes pa gzhan skyes pa yang sngar dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the arising of another cognition in regard to that valid knowledge is no different from the previous one.

original: de bzhin du shes pa gsum pa la sogs pa skyes pa'i dus su yang de 'dra bas na ma rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du shes pa gsum pa la sogs pa skyes pa'i dus su yang de 'dra bas na ma rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: So too, when the third moment of consciousness and so on arises, it would be noncomprehending, since it is similar to the first moment of consciousness.

original: de'i phyir tshad ma skyes pa tsam gyis rtogs par tha snyad byed pa'i phyir de nyid kyis rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du rigs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad ma skyes pa tsam gyis rtogs par tha snyad byed pa'i phyir de nyid kyis rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du rigs te /
translated: Therefore, since it is conventionally said that one comprehends an object merely by the arising of valid knowledge, it is logical that valid knowledge itself is the nature of comprehension.

original: rtogs pa yang 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa yang 'bras bu'o //
translated: And comprehension is the result of valid knowledge.

original: de nyid mngon sum gyis shes pa'i tshad ma'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de nyid mngon sum gyis shes pa'i tshad ma'i 'bras bu'o //

analyzed: go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa'i ngo bo'i yang med na mi 'byung bar nges par rgyu nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: And because the nature of the object to be understood and the object that understands it are ascertained as necessarily not occurring in the absence of the other, they are causes.

original: yang gsungs @332a * //
analyzed: yang gsungs @332a * //
translated: Moreover, it is said:

original: pa ; tshogs pa la sogs gang rnams la /
analyzed: pa ; tshogs pa la sogs gang rnams la /
translated: Those that are a collection and so forth

original: de 'dra'i 'brel pa yod min pas //
analyzed: de 'dra'i 'brel pa yod min pas //
translated: do not have such a relationship.

original: de rnams gtan tshigs min zhes smra //
analyzed: de rnams gtan tshigs min zhes smra //
translated: Therefore, they are said not to be reasons.

original: med na 'ang 'byung ba srid phyir ro //
analyzed: med na 'ang 'byung ba srid phyir ro //
translated: because even if it does not exist, it is possible for it to arise.

original: zhes so // 'brel pa de yang bsgrub par bya ba'i don la rtags kyi dngos po las bsgrub par bya ba'i don gyi rang bzhin gyi phyir dang / bsgrub par bya ba'i don las 'byung ba'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes so // 'brel pa de yang bsgrub par bya ba'i don la rtags kyi dngos po las bsgrub par bya ba'i don gyi rang bzhin gyi phyir dang / bsgrub par bya ba'i don las 'byung ba'i yang phyir ro //
translated: And that relation is because the nature of the probandum is the entity of the reason, and because it arises from the probandum.

original: de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa dang / de las byung ba ma yin pa'i yang de las 'brel pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa dang / de las byung ba ma yin pa'i yang de las 'brel pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: And because that which is not its nature and that which does not arise from it are not related to it.

original: de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba dag kyang rang bzhin dang 'bras bu dag nyid kyi phyir de dag nyid kyis dngos po grub po ;
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba dag kyang rang bzhin dang 'bras bu dag nyid kyi phyir de dag nyid kyis dngos po grub po ;
translated: And because its identity and its arising are just its nature and its effect, they are established by those two.

original: dgag pa bsgrub pa /
analyzed: dgag pa bsgrub pa /
translated: The proof of negation

original: ji skad bshad pa nyid kyis mi dmigs pa las te /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa nyid kyis mi dmigs pa las te /
translated: is just as explained, from nonapprehension.

original: rig bya ma yin pa mi dmigs pas ni med par bsgrub par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rig bya ma yin pa mi dmigs pas ni med par bsgrub par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable to prove nonexistence by the nonapprehension of the imperceptible.

original: dmigs par byed pa ni dmigs par bya ba'i sgrub par byed pa nyid yod na dngos po nyid bsgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: dmigs par byed pa ni dmigs par bya ba'i sgrub par byed pa nyid yod na dngos po nyid bsgrub pa yin no //
translated: If the object of the operation exists, then the existence of the thing is established.

original: rig bya ma yin pa mi dmigs pa ni dngos po yod dam med kyang rung ba las yin na ji ltar 'di'i dngos po med pa bsgrub par 'gyur /
analyzed: rig bya ma yin pa mi dmigs pa ni dngos po yod dam med kyang rung ba las yin na ji ltar 'di'i dngos po med pa bsgrub par 'gyur /
translated: But the non-apprehension of the imperceptible is possible even when the thing exists or does not exist; so how can it establish the non-existence of the thing?

original: gang du gcig bkag pas cig shos kyi med pa bsgrub par 'gyur ba de'i yang rig bya mi dmigs pa nyid go byed yin te /
analyzed: gang du gcig bkag pas cig shos kyi med pa bsgrub par 'gyur ba de'i yang rig bya mi dmigs pa nyid go byed yin te /
translated: And in the case of the apprehension of the incompatible, the non-apprehension of the imperceptible itself is the means of cognition,

original: dgag bya'i mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid thob pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dgag bya'i mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid thob pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is the non-apprehension of the object of negation that is the means of establishing the non-existence of the object of negation.

original: don gyi khyad par gyi 'gal ba med pa dmigs pa ni don gyi khyad par med par go bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don gyi khyad par gyi 'gal ba med pa dmigs pa ni don gyi khyad par med par go bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The apprehension of the non-existence of the incompatible is not the means of cognition of the non-existence of the incompatible,

original: de dag gi lhan cig pa'i ngo bo srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi lhan cig pa'i ngo bo srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the existence of their co-inherence is possible.

original: 'gal ba dmigs pa ni rig bya mi dmigs pa nyid la brgyud de nang du 'du ba yin no //
analyzed: 'gal ba dmigs pa ni rig bya mi dmigs pa nyid la brgyud de nang du 'du ba yin no //
translated: The apprehension of the incompatible is indirectly included in the non-apprehension of the imperceptible.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dgag pa grub po //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dgag pa grub po //
translated: And for that very reason, the negation is established.

original: 'di sa ni rtags kyi khyad par gzhan yongs su brtags pa smras pa'i phyir bzlog pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di sa ni rtags kyi khyad par gzhan yongs su brtags pa smras pa'i phyir bzlog pa yin no //
translated: This is a reply to the statement of another distinguishing mark of the inferential sign, because it is a reversal.

original: de'i yul ni spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de'i yul ni spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Its object is the universal characteristic.

original: 'dis mtshon par 'gyur bas na mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'dis mtshon par 'gyur bas na mtshan nyid do //
translated: It is a characteristic because it is indicated by that.

original: spyi ni thun mong ba bye brag ma phye ba ste 'di'i ngo bo ni mtshan nyid da spyi'i mtshan nyid de'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: spyi ni thun mong ba bye brag ma phye ba ste 'di'i ngo bo ni mtshan nyid da spyi'i mtshan nyid de'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The universal is the commonality without distinction. Its nature is the universal characteristic. Its characteristic is the universal characteristic.

original: bye brag nges pa ma bzung ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid kho na'o //
analyzed: bye brag nges pa ma bzung ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid kho na'o //
translated: It is only the individual characteristic that is not grasped as a particular determination.

original: de tshul gsum pa'i rtags las skyes pa'i rjes su dpag pa de'i yul lo //
analyzed: de tshul gsum pa'i rtags las skyes pa'i rjes su dpag pa de'i yul lo //
translated: That is the object of the inference that arises from the trimodal sign.

original: rjes su dpag pa la snang ba la don bya ba byed pa nyid du zhen par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la snang ba la don bya ba byed pa nyid du zhen par 'gyur te /
translated: In the appearance of inference, there is an adherence to the performance of an object's function.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kho na don bya ba byed pa yin gyi ci rigs ni sreg pa dang 'tshed pa la sogs pa la nye bar sbyor ba ma yin @332b te ;
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kho na don bya ba byed pa yin gyi ci rigs ni sreg pa dang 'tshed pa la sogs pa la nye bar sbyor ba ma yin @332b te ;
translated: Only the individual characteristic performs the function of an object, but the universal is not applied to burning, cooking, and so on, as is appropriate.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kho na de la nye bar sbyor bar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kho na de la nye bar sbyor bar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is seen that it is applied only to its own characteristic.

original: gzhan ni nges par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan ni nges par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not ascertained as anything else.

original: gzhan yang nges pa'i bdag nyid kyi rjes su dpag pas gzung yul du byed pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid las gzhan 'di'i yul ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang nges pa'i bdag nyid kyi rjes su dpag pas gzung yul du byed pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid las gzhan 'di'i yul ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, because it is apprehended by inference that has a definite nature, its object is not other than its own characteristic.

original: yang gsungs pa /üîΩde yi ngo bo min pa las //
analyzed: yang gsungs pa / de yi ngo bo min pa las //
translated: Moreover, it is said:üîΩBecause it is established as the mere negation ofüîΩwhat is not its nature,

original: log pa'i dngos tsam bsgrub phyir dang // dbye ba rab tu mi gnas phyir //
analyzed: log pa'i dngos tsam bsgrub phyir dang // dbye ba rab tu mi gnas phyir //
translated: and because it is not a basis for differentiation,

original: spyi ni rtags kyi yul du brjod //
analyzed: spyi ni rtags kyi yul du brjod //
translated: the universal is said to be the object of inference.

original: ces so // 'o na rjes su dpag pa don med pa 'dzin pa de ji ltar rang gi mtshan nyid yul du 'gyur /
analyzed: ces so // 'o na rjes su dpag pa don med pa 'dzin pa de ji ltar rang gi mtshan nyid yul du 'gyur /
translated: Well, if the object of inference is a universal, how can its object be a particular?

original: bden te / 'on kyang shes pa'i yul ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bden te / 'on kyang shes pa'i yul ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: It is true, but the object of consciousness is twofold:

original: gzung ba dang thob par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzung ba dang thob par bya ba'o //
translated: that which is apprehended and that which is obtained.

original: gang snang ba'i shes pa skye bar 'gyur ba de ni gzung ba'o //
analyzed: gang snang ba'i shes pa skye bar 'gyur ba de ni gzung ba'o //
translated: That which produces a consciousness to which it appears is apprehended.

original: gang du zhen par 'gyur ba de ni thob par bya'o //
analyzed: gang du zhen par 'gyur ba de ni thob par bya'o //
translated: That to which one becomes attached is obtained.

original: de la rjes su dpag pa'i gzung yul ni don med pa'o //
analyzed: de la rjes su dpag pa'i gzung yul ni don med pa'o //
translated: The inferred object is the non-existent object.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid ni thob par bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid ni thob par bya ba'o //
translated: The object to be attained is the object of one's own characteristic.

original: mngon sum gyi skad cig ma gcig ni gzung ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi skad cig ma gcig ni gzung ba'o //
translated: The object of apprehension is the one moment of direct perception.

original: rgyun ni thob par bya ba'i yul lo //
analyzed: rgyun ni thob par bya ba'i yul lo //
translated: The object to be attained is the continuum.

original: de ni nam yang rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid kyi rgyun la zhen par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ni nam yang rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid kyi rgyun la zhen par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But it is never the case that one is attached to the continuum because of the absence of conceptualization!

original: de lta na yang zhen par 'gyur ba'i rnam par rtog pa yid ches pa bskyed pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang zhen par 'gyur ba'i rnam par rtog pa yid ches pa bskyed pa yin no //
translated: Even so, the conceptualization that produces attachment is generated.

original: nges pa mi skyed pa'i mngon sum ni 'jug par byed pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir tshad ma zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: nges pa mi skyed pa'i mngon sum ni 'jug par byed pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir tshad ma zhes mi bya'o //
translated: Direct perception that does not produce ascertainment is not called valid knowledge because it does not engage.

original: nges pa ni 'di snyam pa nyid kyis bde ba dang sdug bsngal bsgrub pa dag la thob pa dang spong ba'i phyir 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nges pa ni 'di snyam pa nyid kyis bde ba dang sdug bsngal bsgrub pa dag la thob pa dang spong ba'i phyir 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Ascertainment is the engagement in the attainment and abandonment of pleasure and pain, respectively, by the mere thought, This is it!

original: rjes su dpag pa'i yang 'dir thob par bya ba nyid kyi yul sems kyi gzhan gyi ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i yang 'dir thob par bya ba nyid kyi yul sems kyi gzhan gyi ma yin te /
translated: Inference also does not have an external object as its object to be attained here.

original: de'i thob par bya ba'i yul sems pa la dbang po mi byed pa'i phyir ro //üîΩthob par byed pa po tshad ma yin na thob par nus pa nyid yul yin par 'os pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i thob par bya ba'i yul sems pa la dbang po mi byed pa'i phyir ro // thob par byed pa po tshad ma yin na thob par nus pa nyid yul yin par 'os pa yin te /
translated: because the object to be attained is not the domain of the faculty of mind.üîΩIf the means of valid knowledge is the agent of attainment, then the object that is capable of being attained is fit to be the domain.

original: gzung yul ni thob par nus pa'i phyir tshad ma 'di'i yul can nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: gzung yul ni thob par nus pa'i phyir tshad ma 'di'i yul can nyid du 'gyur //
translated: The domain of the object to be grasped becomes the domain of this means of valid knowledge because it is capable of being attained.

original: de'i phyir don med pa 'dzin pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i yul yang rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir don med pa 'dzin pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i yul yang rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the domain of inference is also the particular itself, because it grasps the non-existent.

original: 'dis ni 'di'i spyod yul gzhan la spyod pa'i phyir bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di'i spyod yul gzhan la spyod pa'i phyir bsal ba yin no //
translated: This is the refutation because it operates in a domain other than that of this means of valid knowledge.

original: 'di la yang tshad ma'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa ni mngon sum dang mtshungs te /
analyzed: 'di la yang tshad ma'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa ni mngon sum dang mtshungs te /
translated: And here, the establishment of the result of the means of valid knowledge is similar to that of perception.

original: ji ltar mngon sum gyi tshad ma dang 'bras bu dag gi rnam par gzhag pa byas pas de bzhin du rjes su dpag pa'i yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar mngon sum gyi tshad ma dang 'bras bu dag gi rnam par gzhag pa byas pas de bzhin du rjes su dpag pa'i yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: Just as the establishment of perception and its result is made, so too inference should be seen.

original: 'di la yang sngar dang mtshungs par don dang 'dra @333a * //
analyzed: 'di la yang sngar dang mtshungs par don dang 'dra @333a * //
translated: And here, as before, the similarity to the object is not the domain of inference.

original: ba'i ngo bo ni tshad ma don rtogs pa ni 'bras bu'o //üîΩde la mngon sum ni don dang 'dra ba'i ngo bo zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ba'i ngo bo ni tshad ma don rtogs pa ni 'bras bu'o // de la mngon sum ni don dang 'dra ba'i ngo bo zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The nature of a means of valid knowledge is the ascertainment of an object. The result is the realization of an object.üîΩDirect perception is the nature of an object.

original: de nyid dang don dang 'dra ba'i ngo bor rtogs pa don dang bcas na /
analyzed: de nyid dang don dang 'dra ba'i ngo bor rtogs pa don dang bcas na /
translated: When it realizes an object, it is said to be endowed with an object.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni mi gsal ba thun mong ba'i snang ba yin la don yang de las bzlog pa'i ngo bo bas ji ltar don dang 'dra ba'i ngo bor rung /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni mi gsal ba thun mong ba'i snang ba yin la don yang de las bzlog pa'i ngo bo bas ji ltar don dang 'dra ba'i ngo bor rung /
translated: Inference is an unclear, common appearance. How can it be the nature of an object, since an object is the opposite of that?

original: bden te / 'chad pa po rnams dpyod par 'gyur ba de bzhin du ni tha snyad byed pa po rnams ma yin te /
analyzed: bden te / 'chad pa po rnams dpyod par 'gyur ba de bzhin du ni tha snyad byed pa po rnams ma yin te /
translated: It is true that the expounders of inference will analyze it in that way, but the users of conventional expressions do not.

original: de rnams kyang rjes su dpag pa'i snang ba nyid kyi phyi rol ma yin pa la phyi rol du zhen nas de'i don bya bar 'dod pa rnams 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de rnams kyang rjes su dpag pa'i snang ba nyid kyi phyi rol ma yin pa la phyi rol du zhen nas de'i don bya bar 'dod pa rnams 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: They are not the appearances of inference itself, but they are engaged in the desire to accomplish the object by conceiving of them as external objects.

original: zhugs nas kyang ji ltar zhen pa bzhin du dngos po thob pas yongs su mgu bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhugs nas kyang ji ltar zhen pa bzhin du dngos po thob pas yongs su mgu bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And having engaged in them, they are satisfied by obtaining the object just as they have conceived it.

original: bdag cag gis sngon yongs su bzung ba ni gzhan la thob pa ni gzhan no snyam du rtogs pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag cag gis sngon yongs su bzung ba ni gzhan la thob pa ni gzhan no snyam du rtogs pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that there is a thought that what was previously grasped is one thing and what is now obtained is another.

original: me ma yin pa la sogs pa las bzlog pa nyid kyi ngo bo sngon dang phyis kyi yid ches pa'i yul nyid kyi phyir ro ;
analyzed: me ma yin pa la sogs pa las bzlog pa nyid kyi ngo bo sngon dang phyis kyi yid ches pa'i yul nyid kyi phyir ro ;
translated: Because the nature of the opposite of non-fire and so on is the very object of confidence at the beginning and at the end.

original: / de'i phyir 'di la yang tha snyad du byed pa'i skye bo'i rtog pa la ltos pas don dang 'dra ba'i ngo bo rnam par 'jog par rigs pa nyid do //
analyzed: / de'i phyir 'di la yang tha snyad du byed pa'i skye bo'i rtog pa la ltos pas don dang 'dra ba'i ngo bo rnam par 'jog par rigs pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, in this case as well, it is reasonable to posit a nature that is similar to the object in dependence on the conceptual thought of a person who engages in conventions.

original: byis pa 'jug pa'i rtog ge las rang don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i le'u ste gnyis pa'o /üîΩ// / gzhan gyi don rjes su dpag pa ni tshul gsum pa'i rtags brjod pa'o //
analyzed: byis pa 'jug pa'i rtog ge las rang don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i le'u ste gnyis pa'o / // / gzhan gyi don rjes su dpag pa ni tshul gsum pa'i rtags brjod pa'o //
translated: This concludes the second chapter on inference for one's own benefit from the treatise on the principles of debate called the Entrance to the Middle Way.üîΩInference for the benefit of others is the statement of a reason that has the three modes.

original: sngar brjod pa'i tshul gsum pa'i rtags kyi rtogs pa po'i tshig ni gzhi gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: sngar brjod pa'i tshul gsum pa'i rtags kyi rtogs pa po'i tshig ni gzhi gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: The statement of a reason that has the three modes previously described is the basis of inference for the benefit of others.

original: des kyang rjes su dpag par bya ba nyid rang gi rtogs pa brjod pas gzhan la gor 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: des kyang rjes su dpag par bya ba nyid rang gi rtogs pa brjod pas gzhan la gor 'jug pa'o //
translated: and that also causes the understanding of the object to be inferred to be conveyed to another.

original: tshig de yang gor gzhug par bya'i rgyud la gnas pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i rgyud nyid kyi phyir rjes su dpag pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: tshig de yang gor gzhug par bya'i rgyud la gnas pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i rgyud nyid kyi phyir rjes su dpag pa zhes brjod do //
translated: And that statement is called inference because it is the cause of the understanding of the object to be inferred in the continuum of another, not because it exists in the continuum of another.

original: 'jig rten na rgyu la 'bras bu 'dogs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten na rgyu la 'bras bu 'dogs pa yin te /
translated: In the world, the cause is figuratively designated as the effect.

original: dper na mar la tshe zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mar la tshe zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, ghee is called ‚Äúlife.‚Äù

original: 'o na tshad ma gtan la 'bebs pa'i skabs su de'i bdag nyid can gyi rjes su dpag pa gtan la dbab par bya ba'i rjes su dpag par btags kyang tshig ni shes pa med pa'i ngo bo tshad ma yin par mi rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na tshad ma gtan la 'bebs pa'i skabs su de'i bdag nyid can gyi rjes su dpag pa gtan la dbab par bya ba'i rjes su dpag par btags kyang tshig ni shes pa med pa'i ngo bo tshad ma yin par mi rigs so zhe na /
translated: If that is so, in the context of determining valid cognition, even though the inference that has the nature of that is designated as the object to be inferred in the inference to be determined, it is not reasonable for the statement to be valid cognition, which has the nature of consciousness.

original: de'i phyir 'di'i gtan la dbab par bya ba nyid rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di'i gtan la dbab par bya ba nyid rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable for that to be the object to be determined.

original: de mi gnas so //
analyzed: de mi gnas so //
translated: It does not remain.

original: ji ltar 'di rjes su dpag pa rgyu nyid kyi phyir rjes su dpag pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du tshad ma'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir tshad @333b ma ma yin pa yang 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: ji ltar 'di rjes su dpag pa rgyu nyid kyi phyir rjes su dpag pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du tshad ma'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir tshad @333b ma ma yin pa yang 'gal ba med do //
translated: Just as this is an inference because it is a cause of inference, so it is not contradictory that it is a valid cognition because it is a cause of valid cognition.

original: de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: It is of two kinds:

original: sbyor ba'i dbye bas chos mthun pa nyid can dang / chos mi mthun pa nyid can no //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i dbye bas chos mthun pa nyid can dang / chos mi mthun pa nyid can no //
translated: that having a similar property and that having a dissimilar property, by the division of application.

original: 'di'i chos mtshungs pa ni chos mthun pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i chos mtshungs pa ni chos mthun pa'o //
translated: Its similar property is the similar property.

original: de'i ngo bo ni chos mthun pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni chos mthun pa nyid do //
translated: Its nature is the state of having a similar property.

original: dpe'i chos can dang lhan cig bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can gyi gtan tshigs kyis 'dra ba nyid du byas pa'o //
analyzed: dpe'i chos can dang lhan cig bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can gyi gtan tshigs kyis 'dra ba nyid du byas pa'o //
translated: It is made similar by the reason of the example subject and the subject to be established together.

original: 'di'i mi mtshungs pa ni chos mi mthun pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i mi mtshungs pa ni chos mi mthun pa'o //
translated: Its dissimilar property is the dissimilar property.

original: de'i ngo bo ni chos mi mthun pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni chos mi mthun pa nyid do //
translated: Its nature is the state of having a dissimilar property.

original: dpe'i chos can lhan cig bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can gyi gtan tshigs kyis mi 'dra ba nyid du byas pa'o //
analyzed: dpe'i chos can lhan cig bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can gyi gtan tshigs kyis mi 'dra ba nyid du byas pa'o //
translated: It is made dissimilar by the reason of the example subject and the subject to be established together.

analyzed: de la ngag dag gi chos mthun pa nyid du brjod par bya ba nyid yin pa de ni chos mthun pa nyid can no //

original: gang gi chos mi mthun pa nyid yin pa de ni mi mthun pa nyid can no //üîΩ'o na yang chos mthun pa nyid can gyi ngag gi rjes su 'gro ba dang phyogs kyi chos dag brjod kyi ldog pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi chos mi mthun pa nyid yin pa de ni mi mthun pa nyid can no // 'o na yang chos mthun pa nyid can gyi ngag gi rjes su 'gro ba dang phyogs kyi chos dag brjod kyi ldog pa ni ma yin no //
translated: That which has a different property is the one having a different property.üîΩMoreover, the statement having the same property expresses the pervasion and the property of the subject, but not the counter pervasion.

original: chos mi mthun pa nyid kyis kyang ldog pa dang phyogs kyi chos brjod kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i ma yin no //
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa nyid kyis kyang ldog pa dang phyogs kyi chos brjod kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i ma yin no //
translated: The statement having a different property expresses the counter pervasion and the property of the subject, but not the pervasion.

analyzed: nyes pa 'di ni mi gnas te chos mthun pa nyid kyis kyang sbyor ba shugs kyis chos mi mthun pa nyid rtogs te /

analyzed: de ltar yang bsgrub bya nges par gyur pa sgrub pa nges pa yin no //

analyzed: gal te gang su yang bsgrub bya med pa nyid na de thams cad sgrub pa med pa yang yin no //

analyzed: chos can gcig la yang bsgrub par bya ba med la sgrub pa yod pa la de'i de la nges pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable that the ascertainment of the probandum exists for one who has no probandum.

original: bsgrub par bya ba med pa la yang sgrub par med pa rtogs te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba med pa la yang sgrub par med pa rtogs te /

original: ldog pa rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: ldog pa rtogs pa'o //

analyzed: de'i phyir bsgrub bya nges par gyur pa bsgrub pa'i rjod par byed pa'i stobs kyis rjes su 'gro ba'i ngag la ldog pa rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the understanding of the counter pervasion in a statement that has the pervasion is by the power of the statement that ascertains the probandum.

original: de bzhin du chos mthun pa nyid kyis kyang rjes su 'gro ba rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos mthun pa nyid kyis kyang rjes su 'gro ba rtogs pa yin te /

analyzed: de med na bsgrub par bya ba ldog pa la gtan tshigs kyi ldog pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //

translated: For, by the ascertainment of the reversal of the probandum, the presence of the property of the dissimilar instance is ascertained from the negative statement.

analyzed: de ltar yang bsgrub bya log pa la nges pas log pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i bsgrub pa yin no //

original: gal te gang ci yang rung ba la sgrub pa yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: gal te gang ci yang rung ba la sgrub pa yod pa nyid de /

analyzed: chos can gcig pa la yang sgrub pa yod la bsgrub par bya ba med na de log pa la log par nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: sgrub pa yod pa la yang bsgrub par bya ba yod par rtogs pa ni rjes su 'gro ba rtogs pa'o //

translated: Therefore, whether it is by the method of positive pervasion or by the method of negative pervasion, by the application of one statement, the existence and nonexistence of the evidence in the similar and dissimilar classes are stated, and so both are not apprehended in one.

analyzed: bye brag tha dad pa yang bye brag khongs su 'dus pa'am /üîΩbye brag dang ldan pa'am /

analyzed: gang skye ba dang ldan pa de ni mi rtag ste /

analyzed: dper na bum pa bzhin bde ba yang skye @334b ba dang ldan pas zhes bya ba ni bye brag tha dad pa med pa'i sbyor ba'o //

original: gang byas pa de thams cad mi rtag ste /
analyzed: gang byas pa de thams cad mi rtag ste /

original: dper na glog bzhin /
